document.heading: Freedom of Information Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-283, the “Freedom of Information Amendment Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-829, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 5, 2000, and December 19, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 22, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 13-581 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-283 became effective on April 27, 2001.
